summary: Project includes a full ICP canister template app (Motoko backend + React/Vite frontend with shadcn/ui, Internet Identity auth hooks, typed actor bindings, and build/deploy tooling) and an evolving Magical Service sofa/AC cleaning landing site that now incorporates rich marketing sections (service grid, service areas, Google Maps embed, reviews + Google review CTA, social/contact links), WhatsApp-based booking form, pricing/rate list sections, AI-style price estimator UI, and a UPI QR payment section.

existing_features.title: Refactor `frontend/src/components/LandingPage.tsx` to match the structure and styling of the user-provided HTML snippet: a minimal single-page layout containing (1) a sticky top navigation bar with logo + brand text and a call button, (2) a two-card services rate list section (Cleaning and AC Service), (3) a centered UPI payment section with QR code + UPI ID + service area caption, and (4) a simple footer. Remove or hide the existing extra marketing sections (hero, estimator, booking form, maps, testimonials, floating WhatsApp button, etc.) so the page renders primarily the new simplified layout.

Convert all non-English user-facing strings in the provided snippet to English in the updated React page (keep all phone number, UPI ID, and pricing values unchanged). Specifically replace the Gujarati heading/subheading in the rate list section with clear English equivalents.

Implement a subtle soft fade-in animation for the UPI payment box (the card that contains the QR code and UPI ID). The animation should trigger on initial render (or when the section scrolls into view) and must not rely on external libraries not already present in the project.

Avoid Font Awesome `<i class="fas ...">` usage from the snippet in the React implementation; use existing icon tooling already in the codebase (e.g., `lucide-react` Phone icon) while keeping the visual intent of a phone icon next to the call-to-action.

Preserve the user-provided external asset URLs exactly where used in the snippet, including the logo URL `https://magical-sofa-cleaning-7pe.caffeine.xyz/logo.png` and the QR generator URL `https://api.qrserver.com/v1/create-qr-code/?size=180x180&data=upi://pay?pa=jrg7311@okicici&pn=Magical%20Service&cu=INR`. architectural_notes: Project scaffold expanded to a full ICP template: Motoko backend canister and React/Vite frontend, with canister YAML configs and generated DID/type bindings.
Frontend authentication includes Internet Identity support with dedicated hooks/utilities and linting rules enforcing provider usage.
UI stack includes Tailwind + shadcn/ui with a broad set of prebuilt UI primitives added under frontend src/components/ui.
Repository now contains build-template tooling (Dockerfile, workspace configs, image resize/prune scripts, deploy script) to standardize build/deploy.

A standalone reusable ICP app template is maintained under build-template/ (Dockerfile, deploy tooling, backend/frontend canister YAMLs, ESLint rules, shadcn/ui primitives), mirroring the main project structure for standardized export/reuse.

Build-template packaging/export readiness improved: includes LICENSE/README, pnpm workspace/package configs, and icp.yaml/deploy tooling to support standardized reuse/export (e.g., via GitHub/ICP CLI workflows).
Frontend now includes a StorageClient utility to centralize and standardize client-side persisted state access (e.g., local/session storage) for hooks/utilities.
Frontend/build-template linting expanded with a dedicated ESLint rule to prevent using BigInt values in query keys (avoids caching/serialization pitfalls in query libraries).
Frontend now includes a dedicated LandingPage component and app wiring (App/main/index.html/css) to render the sofa/AC cleaning service landing page within the ICP React/Vite template.

Landing page is being expanded with multiple standalone marketing sections (booking via WhatsApp redirect, pricing cards, UPI QR payment, reviews/Google review CTA, service areas, map embed, social links) that should be modularized into reusable components.
